{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3070817,"name":"Ayush","username":"AyushSalunke","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/c2a13f/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-06-29T05:26:00.442Z","cooked":"

Hello, I am trying to follow Bill Kinahan’s Youtube Videos in trying to simulate FRC robot code in Unity. So far I have successfully managed to use Websockets and connect the backend robot code to the Unity simulation to run teleoperated mode.
My question is now I want to get inputs from my unity simulation such as encoder values from my simulation to my Wpilib code to run and test autonomous mode. I want to use these values in my code. I know this can be done through the very same WebSockets that I used to connect these two, but I do not know-how.
Please help me in any way possible. Any help will be much appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2022-06-29T05:26:00.442Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":36,"reads":124,"readers_count":123,"score":204.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":413094,"topic_slug":"question-regarding-use-of-unity-simulation-with-java-code","display_username":"Ayush","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qryc2ck-AgY&t=674s","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC Chassis Build Demo in Unity - YouTube","clicks":28}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53314,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/question-regarding-use-of-unity-simulation-with-java-code/413094/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3071475,"name":"Andrew Schreiber","username":"Andrew_Schreiber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/andrew_schreiber/{size}/209563_2.png","created_at":"2022-07-04T04:43:08.551Z","cooked":"

You should be able to configure an encoder in the unity UI. If it’s a pair of digital pins it should work on the unity side.

From your code you should be able to register an encoder and then read from it as normal.

As for the Rev/CTRE encoders in the motors, I haven’t figured it out yet. I just got an external program to talk to wpilib sockets… and by external program, I mean postman.

Edit: Yes, just confirmed that if you initialize an encoder and work with it like normal. The Unity sim stuff should just work if you’ve wired it up correctly on the unity side. The video goes into it a bit.
